page.title: 01Forestry & Farming
page.content: Once this was all open rough grazing, dry stone wall country. Now some remains but most of the hills have been taken over by the Forestry Commission. The pine trees have eaten up the sheep. The remaining farms occupy the rich river land where cultivated grass feeds beef cattle and sheep. The shepherd and his dog have gone . The farmer moves his flocks from a land rover. Sometimes he tries a field of barley and loses it all in a bad year like 1985. The houses are widely scattered. Farms are substantial but not opulent, cottages are single storey. Local employment is farming or forestry. The few other householder work in small town 15 miles away. Everyone gets about by car, only holidaymakers walk. The roads are good and well
